description.narrative: In 1996 the International Development Association (IDA), World Bank Fund for the Poorest and the International Monetary Fund (IMF) launched the Heavily Indebted Poor Countries (HIPC) Initiative. The initiative calls for the voluntary provision of debt relief by all creditors and aims to provide a fresh start to countries with foreign debt that places too great of a burden on export earnings or fiscal revenues. Australia's contribution to IDA17 will facilitate: the recruitment and training of 1 to 1.2 million teachers; immunisation of 99 to 116 million children; construction of 34 to 44 thousand kilometres of road; and provision of water sources and sanitation facilities to 36 to 42 million and 1.8 to 2.2 million people respectively. The total value of this initiative is $39.2 million expensed during the 2013-14 financial year.
